data.title: The name says it all
data.text:
We went for a trivia night, which we expected would make it busy. We were right...The place was PACKED.
The service left some to be desired. The waitress was very friendly, but definitely overwhelmed. She kept telling us that they had no hostess, they were down a cook, etc to excuse the long wait for food. 

When we got the food, however, it was really good (dare I say Damgoode). I like a very simple pizza - one topping, which is usually roasted garlic.They do it very well!!  My buddies got specialty pizzas, and seemed to enjoy them as much as I did. The crust is tasty and the sauce is spiced nicely without overwhelming the topping.
They also have a few craft beers on tap. I tried a couple of them and was pleased with both.

Back to the delay... The manager came and spoke to us. She stated that the waitress may have gotten busy and forgot to turn in the ticket right away. That made for about an hour wait. She was very apologetic, and ended up taking 75% off the pizzas.

All-in-all a good pizza joint. I'm not from the area, but if I swing back through on business, this will make my "return to" list.

data.title: Always superb
data.text:
We have been to Damgoode Pies many times and it's about time I write a review because this pizza is awesome. One caution right up front - if you order a stuffy (two crust pizza) you will need to wait about 45 minutes to get your food. We generally get some cheese bread or Fred bread while we wait - both are very tasty. 

Part of the family loves the stuffy version. The rest of us like the hand tossed. The hand tossed is basted and has a great flavor. The toppings are always fresh. You get to pick your sauce. My favorite is the tomato basil and my wife's favorite is the spicy. 

The service is consistently good. They keep the drinks filled and have some beers on tap. There are plenty of TVs they generally have tuned to sports channels. 

We highly recommend Damgoode pies so long as you aren't in a hurry.

data.title: Variety of Good Pizza
data.text: They have a great selection of fresh ingredients and three pizza crust types: thin crust, hand-thrown, and deep-dish...  The thin crust is good but not like a wood-oven kind but more like a cracker, but good.  Our favorite is the hand-thrown which is relatively thin, spongey, and fresh (without the common yeasty tastes in deep-dish pizzas.  We also love the Spinach and Greek Salads -- covered with yummy additions, and always on fresh greens. Spinach salad with Vidalia Onion dressing is incredible, and a great value...

data.title: They serve dam good pies
data.text: Really good pizza with a variety of ingredients.  They do deliver which is the best part.  Finding parking can sometimes be difficult

data.title: Dang Good Pizza
data.text: So for the longest time I thought this place was an Irish pub serving Shepherds pie, until a friend told me it was a pizza place! My fiancé and I went for lunch after hitting up the Fayetteville Farmers Market (a must see). We shared the 14" Margarita and added sausage and it was large enough for us to have two pieces left over. The pizza was satisfying and delicious and the atmosphere is cool. Has a big bar and looks like a weekend night spot for college kids, but lunch was enjoyable as well.

data.title: Name says it all
data.text: This is not the average pizza place.  It is custom pizza and it is really good.  Try a pie, it is damgood.

data.title: A Nice Experience
data.text:
The Thai place next door was closed, we were hungry, and stuck our heads in the door to take a look. The delicious aroma lured us in and we decided to eat here. Not exactly Thai, but...

We were seated promptly and our drink order taken. The wine list was small, but more than adequate. The draft beers the same. We were both able to get drinks to our liking. I like a nice IPA, and Mrs. prefers red wine. We were happy with our selections.

We ordered salads and were impressed with size and quality - generous servings of fresh greens and toppings.

The 10" pizza was more than enough for the two of us. They offered a neat and different selection of sauces and we opted for the tomato basil. A tasty choice!

The service was excellent, the food very good. We left happy.

data.title: Fantastic stuffy pizza
data.text: We order delivery from here about once a week. The stuffy pizza is excellent. I add pepperoni and black olives. The red sauce is so good. Only complaint I have is the price. It costs $1.00 to add the black olives to a 6 inch pizza. But, it's so good, I'll pay for it. :)

data.title: "I will be back"
data.text: Great service. I wanted a meatless pizza and I got one that was very tasty! There was a TV on, a group of small softball players celebrating, and I still enjoyed the place. This was the ultimate meal. Can't wait to come back and try a another veggie pizza.

data.title: Great dep dish pizza!
data.text: The best deep dish pizza south of Chicago!  Try the pink sauce...spicy!  Ice cold beer and good service!

data.title: This truly Is A Dam Good Pie
data.text:
They have some very interesting pizza choices, one of which is to make your own ( I know a lot of people have this, but they have some interesting sauces ).  
   Parking is a paint, but the walk is worth it.

data.title: Average pie
data.text: Good atmosphere, but the pie is nothing too special.  For the price, I would prefer a chain pizza.  It's not bad, but we are lucky to have other places in town that have better pizza at a better value.

data.title: Great Pizza in Fayetteville
data.text: Ate as a group of 7 & 4 large pizzas were actually too much.  I am finicky about pizza - don't like deep dish, like Italian style, but this was in-between thick & thin & really excellent - both the vegetarian and a version with ground meat & another with chicken.  Very casual; can accommodate larger groups; our waitress was helpful.  I saw this same chain in Little Rock, don't know if it's as good there or not but probably worth a try.

data.title: Great pizza. Delivery as promised!
data.text: Ordered pizza delivery when I was staying at a hotel. Everything was perfect and on-time. The pizza was so good. I'm not crazy about the sauce on the top but it was really good.  The pizza was a little more expensive but the taste was worth it.

data.title: Not a pizza fan and loved the place
data.text: Try making your own pizza combination, I like the stuffy and the tomato basil. If you are vegan (not me ) highly recommend the garden supreme.. enjoy!

data.title: Amazing Pies!!!
data.text: The name says it all!!! I had a "Stuffy Hog" (all meat with a pan crust). It was nothing I have ever had before and that's ment as a huge complement!!! I would eat here a lot if I lived in the area.

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: These guys make great pizza with varied sauce combinations as well.  A little pricey, but great pizza nonetheless.

data.title: Just OK
data.text: I really wanted to like this place, but it was just OK. Atmosphere is good, service was good, but the pizza was basic, nothing special and the prices were a bit high in my opinion. Also had a salad, it lacked a decent amount of toppings, ranch was good.

data.title: Declining
data.text: This was a great place when it first opened several years ago.  Unfortunately, like most businesses, it hasn't stood the test of time.  Don't get me wrong, the pizzas offered are still some of the best varieties around.  Custom building your own pizza, right down to the mix of sauce, is wonderful.  But I can tell they are starting to cut corners.  One of the best "tells" is when your choice of beer offered is "sorry, not available right now".  If you've never owned a bar you would not know how cheap it is to stock.  Alcohol has an immense profit margin.  If the owners don't invest some money in the future of this place it will go by the wayside, like most others.

data.title: Damgoode
data.text: I don't get excited about pizza places.  I make a wicked pizza at home.  That said, I recently asked my husband to stop on our way through town to eat at Damgoode Pizza--they really are that good.  Awesome pizza, made the way we requested.  The pepperoni are great; I could just eat a chunk with crackers.  The pizzas are pricy and I don't even care.
